Class Questions

java.lang.Object
database.repository.Repository<Question>
database.repository.repos.Questions
All Implemented Interfaces:
IRepository<Question>
public class Questions extends Repository<Question>
Repository class for managing Question entities in the database.

This class provides methods for performing CRUD operations on the "Questions" table, including creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting questions. It extends the Repository class, which provides base functionality for database operations.

Author:
Dhruv

      Creates a new question in the "Questions" table.

      Validates the Question entity before inserting it into the database.

      Specified by:

      Overrides:

      Parameters:
      question - The Question object to be created.
      Returns:
      The created Question object, with its ID set.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the question is invalid.

    • build

      public Question build(ResultSet rs) throws SQLException
      Builds a Question object from a ResultSet.

      This method maps the result set from a SQL query to a Question object.

      Specified by:

      Overrides:

      Returns:

      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs while extracting data from the result set.

    • update

      public Question update(Question question) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Updates an existing question in the "Questions" table.

      This method only updates the title of the question and updates the message content in the associated Message.

      Specified by:
      update in interface IRepository<Question>
      Overrides:
      update in class Repository<Question>
      Parameters:
      question - The Question object containing the updated information.
      Returns:
      The updated Question object if the update was successful, or null if no rows were affected.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the question is invalid.

    • delete

      public void delete(int id)
      Deletes a question from the "Questions" table by its ID.

      The message associated with the question is not deleted explicitly, but it will be removed automatically if a cascading delete rule is set up in the database schema.

      Specified by:
      delete in interface IRepository<Question>
      Overrides:
      delete in class Repository<Question>
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the question to be deleted.

    • getQuestionsByUser

      public List<Question> getQuestionsByUser(int userId)
      Returns a list of questions posted by a particular user.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose questions are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A list of Question objects posted by the user.

    • searchQuestions

      public List<Question> searchQuestions(String keyword) throws Exception
      Searches questions by fuzzy-matching both the title and the content.

      This method retrieves all questions and performs an in-memory fuzzy search using the specified keyword.

      Parameters:
      keyword - The search keyword to match in the question title and content.
      Returns:
      A list of Question objects that match the search keyword.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the search operation.

    • updateQuestionFields

      public Question updateQuestionFields(int questionId, String newTitle, String newContent)
      Updates the title and content of an existing question.

      This method allows updating the question's title and content. If a field is not provided, it will not be updated.

      Parameters:
      questionId - The ID of the question to be updated.
      newTitle - The new title for the question (can be null if not updating).
      newContent - The new content for the question (can be null if not updating).
      Returns:
      The updated Question object if the update was successful, or null if the question was not found.

    • getUnansweredQuestions

      public List<Question> getUnansweredQuestions()
      Returns a list of unanswered questions.
      Returns:
      A list of Question objects that do not have associated answers.

    • getQuestionsWithoutPinnedAnswer

      public List<Question> getQuestionsWithoutPinnedAnswer()
      Returns a list of questions that do not have a pinned answer.

      This method retrieves questions that either do not have any answers or have answers but none are pinned.

      Returns:
      A list of Question objects that do not have a pinned answer.

    • hasPinnedAnswer

      public boolean hasPinnedAnswer(int questionId)
      Checks if a question has a pinned answer.
      Parameters:
      questionId - The ID of the question to check.
      Returns:
      true if the question has a pinned answer, false otherwise.
